ETYMOLOGY: From Old English scylfe 'a ledge, a projection', from Proto-Germanic *skelfo. Related to Old Norse skelfa 'to shake, split'.

MEANINGS.PATTERN: [sth] on a shelf | a shelf of [sth]
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A flat, horizontal length of wood or other rigid material, attached to a wall or forming part of a unit, used for holding objects.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 固定在墙上或作为家具一部分的平坦、水平的木板或其他坚硬材料，用于放置物品。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She arranged the books neatly on the top shelf.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她把书整齐地摆放在最上面的书架上。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A dangerous submerged rock or sandbank; a narrow, relatively flat expanse of seabed projecting from the coast.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 水下危险的岩石或沙洲；从海岸线延伸出的狭窄、相对平坦的海底区域。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The ship ran aground on an unexpected underwater shelf.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这艘船在一处意想不到的水下暗礁上搁浅了。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A group of words established by usage as having a meaning not deducible from those of the individual words.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: (Of a person or thing) no longer active, useful, or popular; (especially of a woman) considered too old to get married.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （指人或事物）不再活跃、有用或受欢迎；（尤指女性）被认为年事已高，嫁不出去。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: After the project was cancelled, the new technology was left on the shelf.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 项目取消后，这项新技术被束之高阁了。
